subject: Data
title: Precision Agriculture: Farming with Data
description: A 60-second lesson on Precision Agriculture: Farming with Data.

hook.text: A drone flies over a cornfield, mapping soil moisture at the resolution of individual plants.

buildup.text: Precision agriculture uses satellite, drone, and sensor data to optimize water, fertilizer, and planting.

discovery.text: Data-driven farming can reduce water use by 30% and increase yields by 20% on the same land.

twist.text: But precision ag requires expensive technology â€” widening the gap between industrial and small farms.

climax.text: With 10 billion people to feed by 2050, data-driven farming may be a necessity, not a luxury.

punchline.text: The future of food runs on data, not just soil.

quiz.question: How can precision agriculture reduce water use?
options: By using sensor data to optimize irrigation
By moving farms to wetter climates
